2021-04-27T18:52:51-07:00.body: Good evening,  We look forward to opening our 10th season this Saturday, May 1st.  Set up will begin at 7am, the Market lane will close by 8:45am. We open at 9am, close at 2pm. No breaking down until 2pm, Vehicles will not be allowed into the Market until 2:15pm or until all customers have exited.  I will send an email on Friday, it will contain some Market information and attached will be a Map with your placement for this Saturday.  For all new Vendors, our staff will be ready to help you find your location. I highly encourage everyone to please review the email that I sent on Monday, April 19th that provided all the Market information you will need for this season.  Thanks and we can't wait to start our 10th season, from all the phone calls I received last Saturday our customers are ready to see us and we are ready to see all of you.  Cheers, Jamie  --     *Jamie El-KhalOwner/Operator503-504-8615*  *Website:*  *www.sunnysidefarmersmarkets.com <http://www.sunnysidefarmersmarkets.com>  * *Manage My Market :* *http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769 <http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769>*  *Instagram and Facebook <http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769>*

2021-04-30T17:00:00.body: Good morning,  Attached is the Map with your placement for Saturday, May 1st.  There is a part on the Map that says Cove, that is a new area. If you are listed under that section, just check in with us and we will show you where to set up.   We are so excited to start our 10th season to begin tomorrow, I cannot thank you all enough for all the well wishes from last week. Everyone is feeling great and we are excited to open, please keep in mind that the first day is always a bit hectic so be patient with each other.   Here are just a few quick reminders, please read through them. We appreciate everyone doing their part to follow the Market rules, it makes our jobs easier and helps the Market run smoothly.   I encourage everyone to read through the Information email I sent on April 19th, it's more detailed and it has a lot of important information.   Map  If you do not see your name and you are scheduled please call me 503-504-8615 Please note, placement is subject to change especially when our Farms arrive. The placement Map will be sent out weekly, on Fridays.   Booth  Everyone in row 22-39 and row 40-57 You will need to keep the back of your tent open, no back drop  If you drop the back cover of your Tent customers cannot see the other side of the Market, we need everything to remain open and visible.  If this is an issue, we can relocate you to one of the other rows.   Rent payment is due every Saturday to the info booth, please come prepared to make your payment for your next Market day. Everyone must be paid one week ahead, that is how your spot is held. Rent is due to the Info Booth by 10am, we cannot accept Credit Cards at the Booth.   1. Set up is between 7am to 8:45am, Market lane will close at 8:45am. 2. Check in, go to your spot, drop off items, go park and return to set up. 3. There is one entrance in and one out, please keep with the flow of traffic 4. Drive slow!!!! Park in the vendor parking lot, indicated on the Map!!!!  5. Rent is due by 10am to the Information Booth, please let employees know this. Payment on Saturday is to hold your next scheduled market day.  6. All Vendors must come prepared to pay rent, even if your next day is not the following week your rent is applied to your next scheduled day and everyone must stay ahead. We accept Check or Cash, we cannot take CC. 7. Signs for advertising are welcomed and encouraged on the Road, just make sure you pick them up 8. If you do not show up, you will not be refunded. We need to be contacted if you cannot be at the Market, thank you.  9, Consistency is KEY to success, it does take time for word to spread so be patient. 10. Have a clean, presentable Booth. Banner up and stand and talk to customers 11. All Tents must have weights (see weight requirement in rules) 12. Do not breakdown or drive in until after 2:10pm and your booth is broken down. 13. If you have an advertisement let me know and I'll post for you on our Social Media Sites  14. Pets are allowed, they must be on a leash and NOT in or near the food.  15. Every Vendor is responsible to take their own Garbage home, you are not to use the Market Garbage Cans. We are limited to how much we can use from our Landlords, also clean up your area before you leave.  16. If you need to miss a day, try to find someone to run your booth for you. We do allow this, just as long as the person filling in for you is selling your product.   Parking/weights/trash All Vendors must park behind the Building, we need ALL the spots close to the Market for our customers. We will be watching, and you will be asked to move if you do not Park in the Vendor parking.  All Tents must have Weights Everyone must leave their area clean, pick up all trash before you leave  Attendance We have a Tuesday 5pm deadline for cancellation, anytime after the Map is done and we cannot forward your money. It's extremely important to not cancel, it creates gaps in the Market and our customers depend on you being there.  We understand things happen, try to find someone to run your Booth if you cannot attend your scheduled day.   Restrooms We have both men and women indoor restrooms for Vendors only, please keep the restrooms clean. They are located across from the playground, there is a corridor, just follow it and you will see them on your left. Of course, if you are new we will show you.   Live Music  Our Band tomorrow is Cooper Ridge, they have played with us for several years. Always, if the Music is too loud please just let us know and we can adjust it.   I need to reinstate that we do have Four young men at the Market to help, their first priority is to set up the Market for our customers than if they have time they can help you. Please make sure you have adequate help for yourself, we cannot guarantee the boys to help.  And if you do need help it must be something simple, they cannot set up or break down your booth. It's more like something heavy or a tent leg is stuck etc...nothing more than that. Their first priority is to set up and break down the Market.   Remember if you need power you need to bring a source, the Honda Generators are the best ones and you will need an extension cord about 100 ft.  We do not supply power.   Covid  1. Vendors need to wear Face Coverings  2. Sampling is allowed  3.Do not let customers touch the Samples, hand it to them.  4. Every booth must be wiped down and kept sanitized during the Market  5. Please handle product with Gloves  6. Our food court will be set up, so yes we do have outdoor dining.   Snap Please make sure you collect your Tokens and place them in a Ziplock Bag, put your business name on the Bag. When you have a good amount, turn them into me for reimbursement. I will issue you a Check, so indicate who I should write the Check out too on the Bag as well.  Everyone can accept the $5 Green Tokens, those are used as Cash. The $1 Tokens are only used towards Farms, Bottled/jared items such as Salsa, Jams, Sauces. Bakeries you can accept Snap, if you have questions see my email that I sent last week with the Market summary information.  Please remember if you are not eligible to accept the $1, I cannot refund you if you do.   If you have any questions, don't hesitate to call or email me.  This is going to be a great season, I will continue to do all I can to help this Market grow and continue to be successful for you all and our community.   Cheers, Jamie

2021-05-01T01:03:58-00:00.body:
Este es un mensaje Bilingue - This is a bilinguagal message - See below for= Spanish - Vea abajo para Espa=F1ol Hello Vendors, Welcome to the 2021 Forest Grove Farmer's Market! Attached is the market map for the May, 5th, 2021 Farmer=92s Market. Please= read the following important notes for this week's market: * All vendor vehicles should be off the street by 3:45 pm. * Sales can begin as soon as customers start arriving at the market and= all vehicles are gone. * PARKING: Please park at least 1 block away from the market. We want t= o make sure customers have access to the market. MARKET MAP: Attached you will find the map showing your space assignment for the May 5t= h market. Your space will be labeled in chalk on the curb. If you have qu= estions about set up, please check in at the info. booth and find a market = staff/volunteer. SET-UP RULES: * Set-up between 2:00 PM - 3:45 PM. * Cars must enter the market area from the north (21st Ave.) and exit o= n the south end (Pacific Ave.) for both load in and load out (ONE WAY TRAFF= IC ONLY). * Remember to pull over as close as possible to the curb when unloading= and remove your vehicle before you set-up your booth. * Face Coverings/Masks must be worn during set-up, market hours, and te= ar-down. * NO Vendor street parking within 1 block of the market. We want to mak= e sure customers have access to the market. * Public restrooms will be available inside the Adelante Mujeres buildi= ng (entrance to Urban Decanter) Face coverings are require entering the Ade= lante Mujeres building. CLEAN-UP PROCEDURES: * Clean-up between 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM * Vendors are not allowed to enter the market area with vehicles before= 7:15 p.m. * Vendors should re-enter the market ONLY when they have packed/taken d= own their booths and placed items on the sidewalk so they can pull up to th= e sidewalk to load their vehicles. * Vendors must pull their vehicles as close to the sidewalks as possibl= e to allow other vendors to pass by. * Cars must enter the market area from the north (21st Ave.) and exit o= n the south end (Pacific Ave.) for both load in and load out (ONE WAY TRAFF= IC ONLY). * All trash/recycling/waste produced by the vendor must leave with the = vendor. REVIEW COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINES: * Please remember to review the COIVD-19 Safety Guidelines for more inf= ormation. VENDOR PAYMENT PROCESS: * You will receive an invoice on Marketspread for every market you are = scheduled to attend. * You are welcome to pay with a credit card online (through the e-mail = message you receive) or by cash/check at the market info booth. * If you choose to pay by cash/check at the market, please submit paym= ent at the information booth before 7pm on market day. * Reporting sales: Marketspread will send you an email at the end of ea= ch market day to ask about your sales for the day. If you can please fill i= n this information for each market. This helps us show the impact of the ma= rket to the city, sponsors, etc. Your individual information will not be sh= ared publicly, rather we aggregate information about the market as a whole. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns. Stay safe and have fun. Thanks, The market team! Por favor lea= las siguientes tres notas importantes para el mercado de esta semana: Actualizaciones para esta semana: * Todos los veh=EDculos de los vendedores deben estar fuera de la calle= a las 3:45 p.m * Puedes comenzar a vender cuando ya no haya ningun carro en la carrete= ra y los clientes comienzen a llegar. * ESTACIONAMIENTO: Por favor, estacione al menos a 1 cuadra del mercado= . Queremos asegurarnos de que los clientes tengan acceso al mercado. MAPA DE MERCADO: * Adjunto encontrar=E1 el mapa que muestra su asignaci=F3n de espacio p= ara el mercado del 05 de Mayo. Su espacio estar=E1 etiquetado con tiza en l= a acera. Si tiene preguntas sobre la configuraci=F3n, preguntar en el puest= o de informaci=F3n o encontrar un mercado personal / voluntario. REGLAS DE INSTALACI=D3N DEL PUESTO: * Instalaci=F3n del puesto entre las 2:00 p.m. y las 3:45 p.m. * Los autom=F3viles deben ingresar al =E1rea de mercado desde el norte = (21st Ave.) y salir en el extremo sur (Pacific Ave.) tanto para entrar como= para salir (SOLO TR=C1FICO DE UNA V=CDA). * Recuerde detenerse lo m=E1s cerca posible de la acera cuando descargu= e y retire su veh=EDculo antes de poner su carpa. * Las cubiertas faciales deben usarse durante la instalaci=F3n, el hora= rio de mercado y el desmontaje. * NO hay estacionamiento en la calle del vendedor a 1 cuadra del mercad= o. Queremos asegurarnos de que los clientes tengan acceso al mercado. * Los ba=F1os p=FAblicos estar=E1n disponibles dentro del edificio Adel= ante Mujeres (entrada al decantador urbano). Se requiere que los revestimie= ntos faciales entren al edificio Adelante Mujeres. PROCEDIMIENTOS DE LIMPIEZA: * Limpieza entre las 7:00 p.m. y las 8:00 p.m. * Los vendedores no pueden ingresar al =E1rea de mercado con veh=EDculo= s antes de las 7:15 p.m. * Los vendedores deben volver a ingresar al mercado S=D3LO cuando hayan= empacado / retirado sus puestos y colocado art=EDculos en la banqueta para= que puedan estacionar en la banqueta para cargar sus veh=EDculos. * Los vendedores deben llevar sus veh=EDculos lo m=E1s cerca posible de= la banqueta para que pasen otros vendedores mas f=E1cilmente. * Los autom=F3viles deben ingresar al =E1rea de mercado desde el norte = (21st Ave.) y salir en el extremo sur (Pacific Ave.) tanto para entrar como= para salir (SOLO TR=C1FICO DE UNA V=CDA). * Toda la basura / reciclaje / desperdicio producido por el vendedor de= be irse con el vendedor. REVISE LAS DIRECTRICES DE SEGURIDAD DE COVID-19: * Recuerde revisar las Pautas de seguridad de COIVD-19 adjuntas para ob= tener m=E1s informaci=F3n. * PROCESO DE PAGO DEL VENDEDOR: * Recibir=E1 una factura en Marketspread por cada mercado al que est=E9= programado asistir. * Puede pagar con tarjeta de cr=E9dito en l=EDnea (a trav=E9s del mensa= je de correo electr=F3nico que recibe) o en efectivo / cheque en el puesto = de informaci=F3n del mercado. * Si elige pagar en efectivo / cheque en el mercado, env=EDe el pago en= el puesto de informaci=F3n antes de las 7 PM del d=EDa de mercado. * Informes de ventas: Marketapread le enviar=E1 un correo electr=F3nico= al final de cada d=EDa de mercado para preguntar acerca de sus ventas del = d=EDa. Si puede, complete esta informaci=F3n para cada mercado. Esto nos ay= uda a mostrar el impacto del mercado en la ciudad, los patrocinadores, etc.= Su informaci=F3n individual no se compartir=E1 p=FAblicamente, sino que ag= regamos informaci=F3n sobre el mercado en su conjunto. No dude en contactarnos si tiene alguna pregunta o inquietud. Mantente seguro y divi=E9rtete Gracias, El equipo del mercado! Hello Vendors,&nbs= p; =

 

Welcome to the 2021 Forest Grove Farmer's Market!


Attached is the market map for the May, 5th, 2021 Farmer=92s Market.<= u> Please read the following important notes for this week's market: 

  • All vendor vehicles should be off the street by 3:45 pm. 
  • Sales can begin as soon as= customers start arriving at the market and all vehicles are gone. 
  • PARKING: Please park at least 1 block away from the market. We want to make sure customers= have access to the market. 

 

MARKET MAP= :  

Attached you wil= l find the map showing your space assignment for the May 5th market.  Your space will be labeled in chalk on the curb.  If you have questions ab= out set up, please check in at the info. booth and find a market = staff/volunteer. 

 

SET-UP RUL= ES:

  • Set-up between 2= :00 PM - 3:45 PM. 
  • Cars must enter the market area from the&n= bsp;north (21st Ave.) and exit on the south end (Pacific Ave.) for both load in and load out (ONE WAY TRAFFIC ONLY).
  • Remember to pull over as close as possible to the curb when unloading and remove your vehicle before you set-up your booth. 
  • Face Coverings/Masks must be worn during set-up, market hours, and tear-down.
  • NO Vendor str= eet parking within 1 block of the market. We want to make sure customers have access to the market.
  • Public restro= oms&n= bsp;will be available inside the Adelante Mujeres building (ent= rance to Urban Decanter) = Face coverings are require entering the Adelante Mujeres building.

 

CLEAN-UP PROCEDURES:

  • Clean-up betwe= en 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM
  • Vendors are not allowed to enter the market area with vehic= les before 7:15 p.m.
  • Vendors should re-enter the market ONLY when they have packed/ta= ken down their booths and placed items on the sidewalk so they can pull up to the sidewalk to load their vehicles= . 
  • Vendors must pull their vehicles as close to the sidewalks as possible to = allow other vendors to pass by. =
  • Cars must enter the market area from the north (21st<= /b> Ave.) and exit on the south end (Pacific Ave.) for both = load in and load out (ONE WAY TRAFFIC ONLY).
  • All trash/recycling/waste produced by the vendor must leave with th= e vendor.


REVIEW COVID-19 SAFETY GUIDELINES:

  • Please remember to review the COIVD-19 Safety Guidelines for more i= nformation.

 

VENDOR PAY= MENT PROCESS: 

  • You will receive= an invoice on Marketspread for every market you are scheduled to atte= nd.  
  • You are welcome = to pay with a credit card online (through the e-mail message you receive) o= r by cash/check at the market info booth. 
  •  If you cho= ose to pay by cash/check at the market, please submit payment at the information booth . 
  • Reporting sal= es:&n= bsp;Marketspread will send you an email at the end of each market day to ask about your sal= es for the day. If you can please fill in this information for each ma= rket. This helps us show the impact of the market to the city, sponsors, et= c. Your individual information will not be shared publicly, rather we aggregate information about the market = as a whole. 

 

Please do not he= sitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns. 

Stay safe and ha= ve fun.


Thanks, 

 

The market = team! 

 

 

 

En espa=F1ol *** Traducido = por Google ***

Adjunto esta el mapa del merca= do agricola del 5 de Mayo 2021. Por favor lea las siguientes tres notas importantes para el mercado de esta se= mana:



Actualizaciones para esta s= emana:

  • Todos los veh=EDculos de los vendedores de= ben estar fuera de la calle a las 3:45 p.m
  • Puedes comenzar a vender cuando ya no haya ningun carro en = la carretera y los clientes comienzen a llegar. 
  • ESTACIONAMIENTO: Por favor, estacione al menos a 1 cuadra del mercado. Queremos asegurarnos de que los clientes = tengan acceso al mercado.

 

MAPA DE MERCADO:<= /u>

  • Adjunto encontrar=E1 el mapa que muestra s= u asignaci=F3n de espacio para el mercado del&nb= sp;05 de Mayo. Su espacio estar=E1 etiquetado con tiza en la acera. Si tiene preguntas so= bre la configuraci=F3n, preguntar en el puesto de informaci=F3n o encontrar= un mercado personal / voluntario.

 

REGLAS DE INSTALACI= =D3N DEL PUESTO:

  • Instalaci=F3n del puesto entre las 2:00 p.= m. y las 3:45 p.m.
  • Los autom=F3viles deben ingresar al =E1rea= de mercado desde el norte (21st Ave.) y salir en el extremo sur (Pacific Ave.) tanto para entrar como para salir (SOLO TR=C1FICO DE UNA V=CDA).
  • Recuerde detenerse lo m=E1s cerca posible = de la acera cuando descargue y retire su veh=EDculo antes de poner su carpa= .
  • Las cubiertas faciales deben usarse durante la instalaci=F3n, el horario de mercado y el desmontaje.
  • NO hay estacionamiento en la calle del = vendedor a 1 cuadra del mercado= . Queremos asegurarnos de que los clientes tengan acceso al mercado.<= /li>
  • Los ba=F1os p=FAblicos estar=E1n disponibles dentro del edificio Adelante Mujeres (entrada al decantador urbano). Se re= quiere que los revestimientos faciales entren al edificio Adelante Mujeres.=

PROCEDIMIENTOS DE LIMPIE= ZA:

  • Limpieza entre las 7:00 p.m. y las 8:00 p.= m.
  • Los vendedores no pueden ingresar al =E1re= a de mercado con veh=EDculos antes de las 7:15 p.m.
  • Los vendedores deben volver a ingresar= al mercado S=D3LO cuando hayan empacado / retirado sus puestos y colocado = art=EDculos en la banqueta para que puedan estacionar en la banqueta para cargar sus veh=EDculos.
  • Los vendedores deben lleva= r sus veh=EDculos lo m=E1s cerca posible de la banqueta para que pasen otro= s vendedores mas f=E1cilmente.
  • Los autom=F3viles deben ingresar al =E1rea= de mercado desde el norte (21st Ave.) y salir en el extremo sur (Pacific Ave.) tanto para entrar como para salir (SOLO TR=C1FICO DE UNA V=CDA).
  • Toda la basura / reciclaje / desperdicio p= roducido por el vendedor debe irse con el vendedor.

REVISE LAS DIRECTRICES D= E SEGURIDAD DE COVID-19:

  • Recuerde revisar las Pautas de seguridad d= e COIVD-19 adjuntas para obtener m=E1s informaci=F3n.

PROCESO DE PAGO DEL VEND= EDOR:

  • Recibir=E1 una factura en Marketspread por= cada mercado al que est=E9 programado asistir.
  • Puede pagar con tarjeta de cr=E9dito en l= =EDnea (a trav=E9s del mensaje de correo electr=F3nico que recibe) o en efe= ctivo / cheque en el puesto de informaci=F3n del mercado.
  • Si elige pagar en efectivo / cheque en el mercado, env=EDe el pago en el puesto de informaci=F3n antes de las 7 PM del d=EDa de mercado.
  • Informes de ventas: Marketapread le enviar=E1 un correo electr=F3nico al final de cada d=EDa de mercado par= a preguntar acerca de sus ventas del d=EDa. Si puede, complete esta informa= ci=F3n para cada mercado. Esto nos ayuda a mostrar el impacto del mercado e= n la ciudad, los patrocinadores, etc. Su informaci=F3n individual no se compartir=E1 p=FAblicamente, sino que agregamos informaci= =F3n sobre el mercado en su conjunto.


No dude en contactarnos si tie= ne alguna pregunta o inquietud.

Mantente seguro y divi=E9rtete=


Gracias,

El equipo del mercado!<= /p>


Daniela Perez

2021-04-27T16:26:43-07:00.body: Good afternoon,  This is a reminder that our Vendor meeting is scheduled for Tuesday, May 18th at 5:30pm. It will be outdoors, located at the Market site. 1844 SE Cesar Estrada Chavez Blvd.  I will have information regarding the upcoming season, show you where Vendors park and answer questions.  If you cannot make it, I do understand and I will have an email with all the information discussed sent out shortly after so you are prepared for your first Market day.  The Hawthorne Farmers Market opens for our 4th season on Tuesday, June 1st.  If you have any questions, please let me know.  Cheers, Jamie  --     *Jamie El-KhalOwner/Operator503-504-8615*  *Website:*  *www.sunnysidefarmersmarkets.com <http://www.sunnysidefarmersmarkets.com>  * *Manage My Market :* *http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769 <http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769>*  *Instagram and Facebook <http://www.managemymarket.com/landing.aspx?orgID=769>*

2021-04-29T10:25:18-07:00.body:
This email was sent via ManageMyMarket on behalf of salemcommunitymarkets@gmail.com
<= p style=3D"text-align: center;">

Dear 29 Kettle Confectionery,

I'm sure you have all heard by now that Marion County is one of 15 count= ies that is going back to Extreme Risk level starting on Friday, April 30th= through May 6th. The timeline could be extended up to 3 weeks, however wil= l be evaluated on a weekly basis. 

This will not affect the market being open since we are classified the s= ame as retail (Fred Meyer, Costco, etc). Many of the procedures put in plac= e last year (and continued this year) will remain the same... masks properly worn required by ALL, 1-way aisl= es, designated entrances/exits, etc.

Below is a list of things that will be affected and need to be implement= ed starting April 30th...

  • the maximum capacity allowed in the market will be adjusted accordingly=
  • samples MUST be in an enclosed container
  • live entertainment cancelled 

We continue to monitor and enforce the mask requirement. For the most pa= rt, people take and wear a mask or leave if unwilling to comply. We have ha= d a few situations where people absolutely refuse and continue to stroll th= e market. After an incident last weekend and a lot of phone calls this week= (State police, City police, OSHA, etc)... we will not get support from the local authorities as th= ey are understaffed and enforcement of masks at the market is very bottom p= riority. We are documenting all non-compliance issues which could result in= complaints/closure from OSHA so that we are doing our due diligence and ca= n be prepared if the situation arises.

Enforcement puts staff in a tough position, but we will continue to appr= oach, inform and ask non-compliant guests to leave. Some will still refuse = and we ask that you  PLEASE he= lp us - NO MASK, NO SALES!!!

2021-04-30T08:39:25-07:00.body:
This email was sent via ManageMyMarket on behalf of manager@tigardfarmersmarket.org
<= div style=3D"text-align: center;">

Hello everyone,

This Sunday is the opening day of the Tigard Farmers Market! If you are = scheduled for this Sunday, here is the map. We are currently ex= periencing a few bugs with Manage My Market mapping. Please see the attache= d sheet for your spot number. Please remember that your space might change = if needed. We will let you know if there is a change. If this is yo= ur first time attending the market or need a refresher, please read the loa= d in and out details at the bottom of this email and watch the vendor orie= ntation video. 

Below are the load in time for booth locations: 

  • 7 to 8:30 A.M. - Plaza vendors
  • 7 to 8 A.M. - Parking Lot Vendors
  • 8 to 8:30 A.M. - Tigard Street Vendors

Don't forget to promote that you will be at the market this weekend. Als= o, remember to promote on the day of. Try doing a Facebook/ Instagram Live = video or posting a picture of your booth on your business pages. 

If you have any questions, please feel free to email me. See you Sunday!=  

Thank you,

Jessica Love
Market Manager
Tigard Farmers Market

.  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  = .

Please read the whole email and pass the information to the employee tha= t will be coming to the market if you have not done so. 

Before the Market

  • If there is a change in the dates that are on Manage My Market, you mus= t contact us before 12 PM on the Thursday before if you would like to be ad= ded or removed from that coming Sunday. If we do not hear from you, we will= go off of what is on your market application. 
  • Space fees must be paid in advance. A invoice will be emailed to you be= fore each market day. 
  • If you no show / no contact, you will still be responsible for the spac= e fee. 

Load In

  • Load in can begin NO EARLIER than 7 AM. The street does not close until= 6:30 AM and we need time to get ready for vendor load in. 
  • Vendors must enter Tigard Street from Grant Ave or Tiedeman Ave. You wi= ll not be able to drive your car from Main Street. 
  • You must quickly unload your stuff and move your car immediately. No se= tting up until your car has been moved. There is not a lot of space availab= le for cars to be sitting in the market zone while people set up their boot= h. Please drop and go. 
  • Vendor Parking is located in the B&B Print Source parking lot. It i= s on Ash Street off Burnham Street. Once done unloading your car, take a ri= ght onto Main Street, turn left onto Burnham St. and a right on Ash Street.=  

During the Market

  • If there is an emergency, please help by directing patrons to the side = to get out of the way for the fire trucks. If you are on an end cap, please= help by moving the barricades for fire trucks and then putting them back o= nce they are through. 
  • The restroom is located in the parking lot behind the Tigard Chamber of= Commerce building. 
  • No packing up early! It does not look good to the customers.

Load Out

  • Cars cannot come into the market area until after 1:45 PM unless you ar= e a street vendor at which you can bring your car in at 1:40 p.m.. Parking = Lot vendors can bring their car in as soon as the street vendors have left.= You are not allow to wait in the street in your vehicle until that point s= ince the street is active. 
  • You must take a left off Ash Street, left on Main Street, cross 99W, ri= ght on Grant Ave and a right on to Tigard Street. Enter the market like you= came in. 
  • You must be completely packed up before your car can come into the mark= et. This will allow room for others to bring their car into the market when= they are all packed and ready to load in. Quickly load your vehicle then e= xit heading towards Main Street!
  • If your space if left a mess, you will be charged a $15 cleaning fee.&n= bsp;

Attachments=

Vendor Spaces 5.2.21.pdf<= /a>

2021-04-30T11:52:03-0700.body:
This email was sent via ManageMyMarket on behalf of manager@hillsboromarkets.org

Dear 29 Kettle Confectionery,

Thanks to everyone for joining us for our opening weekend! Here are a fe= w reminders for the upcoming market weekend:

  • Vendor Envelope System
    • A introductory letter of the envelope system can be found in your envel= ope on your first market day
    • Social Distancing Badges and required signage can be found in the envel= opes
    • Please train your staff on how to work the envelope system
  • Mask Requirement
    • Masks must be worn at all times within the market space.
    • Masks must be worn at all times when interacting with market volunteers= or staff, including interactions through vehicle windows.

Please find the links to the market maps here:

  • Downtown Hillsboro Satu= rday Market - 5/1/21
  • Orenco Station Sunday M= arket - 5/2/2021 

See you this weekend!

HFM Staff, 

Liz, Connie, Amy, and Brian

2021-04-29T17:53:52-07:00.body: I have a  spot with electricity. You will pull in from Hood Street onto 3rd. Less then half way down there is an electric box and ther will be ramp going into the park. Take that. You are right next to the electric box. Greg or Ed will help you. Not sure if I will be there yet as I put up signs all over the place. Greg is there at 6:00 AM so you can come early.

2021-04-30T09:51:35-07:00.body:
This email was sent via ManageMyMarket on behalf of manager@greshamfarmersmarket.com

Vendors,

So much has changed since we spoke, Some of you got moved and I tried to= either email or call.  Another vendor set up will be attached.

BATHROOMS> as of this second Friday at 9:30 AM . The city has done a = complete turn around on the Bathroom scene.  Public side of the bathro= om building will be open to the public. No locks nothing just open to the g= eneral public.

You may go there if you wish. But we had to Rent porta potties for the v= endors. Since we are considered an event so union rule will not allow us to= use those facilities so we had to purchase our own. Which took up three mo= re spaces and we already lost 20.  So all those that were sche= duled we got you in this week only because a major farm had to can= cel and That gave me some room. 

Porta potties are located on Beech street.

My phone will go off promptly at 7:30 Pm to let me mentality get ready f= or this. You may text or email but Iffy if I return answer. 

thins happen when setting up and sometime you will get bumped to another= spot. Just go with the flow I say. We will work kinks out. Some of you low= er on the pole will get moved every week until COVID decreases.

I hope you are already. I am sure a lot of you have a lot of last minute= stuff to do as I have been going strong since 4:00 AM.

HOT FOOD FOLKS. I sent you the link to the fire department expectations.= They will be there when you arrive checking that you have proper extinguis= hers and Gas hose lengths. No exceptions. The new inspector will send you h= ome if your not compliant. Again all info is located at the city of Gresham= fired departments web site. 

Also Hot food . Not sure if Multnohma County will be sending out a repre= sentative to check on you to make sure your all paid up on county permits a= nd compliant to What they want. Which is Temps, Hand washing station, other=

Good luck to all of you. Keep your area clean.

 

Have fun,

Jon

 

 

 

 

 

 

Att= achments

friday final for= opening day may 1st 2021.docx

2021-04-29T10:20:54-07:00.body:
This email was sent via ManageMyMarket on behalf of info@orcityfarmersmarket.com

Good Morning!

 

I have loaded your space assignments for this week into our interactive = market map. Simply click on your business name on the upper left corner of = the page and it will highlight your space number/location on the map. For s= ome, your space number is for this week only given one of our large farms i= s out. For those who send employees, please share their booth location with= them.

Oregon City Summer Satur= day Farmers Market 2021 (managemymarket.com)

 

Also, here is the link to our online payment portal for booth fees.

Oregon City Farmers Mark= et - Vendor Fees (maxcheckout.com)

 

See you on Saturday! Remember we are open from 9-2pm now that summer mar= ket has arrived.

 

Questions or concerns? Please reach out!

 

Thanks, everyone!

Jess

2021-04-15T18:12:43-07:00.body: Hello 2021 Vendors, welcome to the 15th season of Montavilla Farmers Market! We are excited to transition into our weekly market season on May 2nd which goes through November 21st. We have some operations reminders as well as a couple of exciting announcements for this season.  Operations Reminders     -     Starting in May, cars must be off the lot by 9:30am    -     Stall Fee Changes: non-farms pay $45, farms pay $42 per 10x10, vendors    who don=E2=80=99t meet our 20% sourcing requirements pay 10% of gross sa= les ($45    minimum), beginning farms (5 years or less) pay $21. You can pay cash/ch= eck    at the market (in your vendor packet) or with a credit/debit card on    FarmSpread (you will be automatically invoiced).    -     Map Changes: Check the MFM website    <https://www.montavillamarket.org/market-vendors> for weekly maps of    your stall location (bottom of page). Many vendors have moved starting i= n    May (especially non-winter vendors).    -     No sampling. We are waiting to =E2=80=9Copen=E2=80=9D high risk activiti= es (including    music and programs) until people have access (and the time) to be fully    vaccinated. You will be informed when sampling can resume.   Exciting Announcements  Xander Anton has joined our team as our new Assistant Market Manager and Volunteer Coordinator! If you need to get a hold of them, please email volunteer@montavillamarket.org.  We are also adding new board members this year. Alex Nydahl, Morgan Schanski, Ellen Flint have officially joined (we are still in the process of adding more), you may see them around the market!  To celebrate our 15th season, Montavilla Farmers Market is going through a brand refresh! We will be rolling our new colors and a logo on May 2nd (along with new merch). We have worked hard with a small design team to update our branding and we are excited to share it with the community.  Finally, we want to welcome our new vendors will be joining us this summer:     -     29 Kettle Confectionery <https://www.29kettle.com/>: Turns four simple    ingredients into exceptional small batched roasted and glazed nuts.    -     Canby Farm and Kitchen <https://canbyfarmandkitchenllc.grazecart.com/>:    An 11-acre farm specializing in heirloom varieties favored by chefs and    restaurateurs.    -     Creole Me Up <https://creolemeup.com/>: Produces allergen-free creole    condiments, sauces, and non-alcoholic fruit cocktail mixes while    encouraging people to learn how to cook Haitian food.    -     Freeland Spirits    <https://www.freelandspirits.com/?gclid=3DCj0KCQjwmIuDBhDXARIsAFITC_5V6f= LN61OxnqaHSIemMiqKbHTzW4XPnjshWE8KPSQfLriHvhk9onQaArfiEALw_wcB>:    Women-owned and operated, Freeland Spirits was founded with a passion to    produce high quality spirits using ingredients that support local    agriculture.    -     Gate 9 Fish <https://marketspread.com/vendor/3610/gate-9-fish/>: Native    caught fish from the Columbia river; bringing the freshest fish to the    Portland areas markets.    -     Love Letter Farm <https://loveletterfarm.com/>: One-woman operation,    intensively growing seasonal vegetables and herbs using ecological    practices.    -     Martson Farm Highland Cattle <https://www.martsonfarm.com/>: Raising    purebred Scottish Highland cattle for over 30 years. Highland cattle are    raised as they were in Scotland for hundreds of years;exclusively grass-= fed    and grass-finished.    -     Moorish Roots <https://marketspread.com/vendor/25313/moorish-roots/>: Employing    ancient ways of Bio-integrated farming devoted to the way of replenishin= g    and nurturing the land rather than merely producing produce.    -     Rangoon Bistro <https://www.rangoonbistropdx.com/>: A collaboration    between two chefs specializing in the distinctive foods of Myanmar    (formerly Burma).    -     Sebastiano's <https://www.sebastianospdx.com/>: Family-owned Sicilian    Deli and Bakery serving the Montavilla neighborhood since June 2020.    -     Sidekick Provisions <https://www.sidekickprovisions.com/>: Small-batch    vegan, gluten-free, and bean-free dips make a perfect snack or meal.    - Wapato Island Farm <https://www.wapatoislandfarm.com/>: Woman-owned,    32-acre working farm handcrafting herbal medicines using farm-grown,    certified organic medicinal herbs and mushrooms.   PS If you need to reach me, my cell phone is 707-499-4766. I get a lot of spam calls, so texting is prefered!  *Lisa Hall (She/Her)*| *Market Manager* Montavilla Farmers Market | montavillamarket.org Every Sunday May through Oct I 2nd and 4th Sundays Nov-April | 10a-2p Market Cell Phone: 503-902-4858

2021-04-29T16:52:31-07:00.body: Ok folks, power should be good to go!      - Vendors bring their own cords    - Vendors are responsible for safely covering their power cord    - Power access is $10 per market  Let me know if you have any questions, see you Sunday! *Lisa Hall (She/Her)*| *Market Manager* Montavilla Farmers Market | montavillamarket.org Every Sunday May through Oct I 2nd and 4th Sundays Nov-April | 10a-2p Market Cell Phone: 503-902-4858
